author: Jamie McIntyre, Travis Tritten
description: NATO JOINS THE COALITION: As the NATO leaders summit kicked off in Brussels this morning, Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg announced that the alliance will formally join the counter-ISIS coalition. NATO’s civilian leader noted that all 28 allies are already individual members of the Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS, and said now NATO as an organization will also be a member. “This will send a strong political message of NATO’s commitment to the fight against terrorism. And improve coordination within the Coalition,” Stoltenberg said. “But it does not mean that NATO will engage in combat operations.
title: NATO joins the coalition to fight ISIS

author: Daniella Diaz and Amanda Wills, CNN
description: The President is in Brussels, meeting with world leaders at the NATO summit. We're covering his moves live.
title: Trump at NATO: Live updates

author: Inside Story
description: US President Donald Trump wants NATO countries to provide more soldiers to fight terrorism.
title: More NATO troops for Afghanistan?

author: BBC News
description: The US president has previously criticised Nato members for not meeting spending targets.
title: Trump in Brussels for 'tough' Nato talks amid protests

author: Ivana Kottasova
description: It's true that NATO countries are increasing their defense spending, but it has little to do with Trump.
title: NATO funding: How it works and who pays what

description: Bis Dezember sollen die Nato-Länder Pläne vorlegen, wie sie höhere Verteidigungsausgaben erreichen wollen. Das Militärbündnis kommt damit US-Präsident Trump entgegen.
title: Nato-Gipfel: Nato-Mitglieder planen höhere Verteidigungsausgaben

author: http://xml.zeit.de/autoren/B/Jochen_Bittner/index.xml
description: Der Nato-Eintritt in die Anti-IS-Koalition gilt nur als Symbol. Nach Trumps Willen soll die Nato aber helfen, Syrien und den Irak zum Friedhof für IS-Kämpfer zu machen.
title: Nato-Beschluss: In der Verantwortung für Trumps Krieg

author: Nicole Gaouette and Elise Labott, CNN
description: President Donald Trump lectured NATO members on their contributions to the trans-Atlantic alliance, potentially alienating the US' closest allies, analysts said
title: Trump pushes around NATO

description: TAORMINA, Sicily (AP) — The Latest on President Donald Trump's visit to Europe (all times local): 12:15 p.m. President Donald Trump says NATO will be stronger because member countries have increased payments "considerably." Trump tweeted Saturday, "Many NATO countries have agreed to step up payments considerably, as they should. Money is beginning to pour in- NATO will be much stronger." NATO countries do not pay the U.S. or NATO directly. They spend domestically on weapons or other defense-related needs. The president supports ongoing efforts to push member countries to spend at least 2 percent of their gross domestic product on defense. Only five members currently meet the target, but the other nations are committed to the goal by 2024. Trump is meeting with leaders from the G-7 nations in Sicily. He also tweeted, "Big G7 meetings today. Lots of very important matters under discussion. First on the list, of course, is terrorism."
title: The Latest: Trump says NATO will be stronger

author: Jacob Pramuk
description: In Brussels, Trump admonished other NATO members for not paying their "fair share" for defense.
title: George W. Bush's NATO ambassador slams Trump's visit with the alliance
